body.name: Pretty Human: A SciFi Alien Romance Novella (Risdaverse)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I finally get to Lord Va'Rin
reviews.reviewText: So I'm reading the Risadaverse in random order, as the Zon shows them to me. And I finally get to the founder of the Risda III refuge, Lord Varina and his mate Milly. Short, sweet, spicy, and worth the wait. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Oh so short, but of course, it’s a novella.
reviews.reviewText: So, I’m currently re-reading my way through the Risdaverse, and I read this book first even though this wasn’t published, I think, until we were a few, maybe four, books into the series. This was part of another author’s collaboration series Ruby did. That is why you may come across two or three other authors that use the same book cover, but have the dress in a different color.That is also why the name doesn’t match up with the others. It’s part of the “Pretty…” series as well as the “Risdaverse”. But if you have gotten this far, you should already know that the naming convention has already been disrupted. Even though it can still be considered a standalone, our real first visit to Risda III is in the Prison Barbarian book.So is this book worth the 2 hour read? I’m sure some of you can polish it off in an hour, and others like me will take a day. But is it worth it? Yes, but only because you meet them again in at least one of the other Risdaverse books. I’m pretty sure that is when Ruby got requests for a story about how they got together and all that.Thanks to the Corsairs we know that even off Not-Hoth the blue guys do suffer from love at first sight when they come across their mates. Personally I think Ruby didn’t want to let that plot point go after living on Not-Hoth for so long and it’s her world she’s creating. So the blue guys fall hard and instantly for their true mates.I like how they met, but because this book was just a novella and most likely shoehorned in between other projects and books, she jumps in time twice and places some events further along than one might expect. The whole story takes place over six weeks but we are only treated to maybe 4 days out of all that time.This story can totally be expanded upon, by someone, but even as this quick little read, it’s an ok story that gives you background on the couple and how the Risdaverse came to be in the first place. Which is why I read it first. 😁

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Short and sweet
reviews.reviewText: This was short and sweet. Its the back story of the whole series. Like how Risda III became the sanctuary for humans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It was ok I guess....
reviews.reviewText: It was OK I guess, I mean what there was to it...This is short as you expect a novella to be ,but there really isn’tmuch here...For some off reason I want to you the word “intense” when I use the word short...You know ,like “short and intense” or “ short but intense”, butt intense isn’t the right word here ,sparse is.There’s not much here.Possibly ⚠️ spoilers ⚠️Varrik and Milly meet after the horrid hostess of the month long party he’s at her estate to attend ,shows him Milly thru a one way window as the “toy” she’s gotten a “ debauched” Lord who has a fetish for “alien flesh”.Varrik who has taken an instant liking to her ( of course ) demands she be given to him), used to being obeyed ,he is.They barely spend one night observing each our and light chit chat,when trying “to fit in” Milly drinks too much wine she hates,and Varrik tucks her into his bed and sleeps in a chair.Milly wakes to this sight and even though she doesn’t want to upset him and wants to be a “good lil slave” ,she does the dumbest thing any of us can do. She assumes.We see her pointless and rather uninteresting jaunt thru the huge mansion/manor passed from one set of his servants to another. I found it pointless personally ,and watching Milly’s ( I guess) sweet but clueless ramble kinda silly and did nothing to raise my opinion of her or help me get to know her.I kinda sorta liked Milly but we never get to know her or Varrik or why they like each other other than the obvious ..Milly who seems oddly ok,being a kidnapped slave from earth,does more then to try to make the best out of a bad situation,she acts more like she was born a slave and this is just more or less what she’s used to. Except she is more than happy to ignore the protocols and rules of stuck up aliens around her and just do whatever Varrik seems to be ok with and allow.Then suddenly three weeks have passed of their seeming platonic relationship where w/out us they’ve supposedly gotten closer and to know each other and their suddenly going to be mated/married to protect Milly and because she doesn’t want to have sex w/the “power balance “ being "Master/Slave”.Yeah, well Milly ole girl,your kinda naive a bit aren’t you... He’s no longer your Master per se but your still in a galaxy where everyone sees you as less then dirt and probably wouldn’t spin on you if you were on fire 🔥. Soo your still ,married or not, completely and totally dependent and beholding to him and his kindness and mercy.So yeah it’s better but....Then sex and basically the end.I’m not sure what to say here,I know tons will love it because,Well because Ms.Dixon wrote it.But while novellas are short that doesn’t mean they have to be lacking . If done right it doesn’t take but a few paragraphs to make you feel like you know someone. Same with two MC’s getting to know each other...This was sparse and vapid. Like biting into a sandwich or a burrito expecting something filling and only finding lettuce and some condiments... you might eat it all but you feel your time wasted because there’s nothing there...Ms. Dixon is a very talented writer but you don’t see it here.If this a first book for you with her,try book one in her “Ice Planet Barbarian” series and go from there. If your a long time fan? You don’t need me to advise you... “Nothing here to see here folks” is how I’d sum this up...Thanks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love Ruby Dixon's books! I've devoured all the Ice Planet series already and working on the Risdaverse now! He's a high born blue alien at a month long big wig party. She's a slave meant for another as a party gift, but he claims her for himself though it means he'll be reviled. They get married any way and head out to his private planet to live their best life away from the aristocracy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Short and Sweet
reviews.reviewText: I'm working my way through Ruby's works and this one is cute and sweet but I missed the build up you usually get with longer stories. Without the build up, they fall on love so fast and I'm less invested. It's not the worst thing and it's certainly not stopping me from reading the rest of her work. Enjoy it this novella for what it is :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Human and Alien Romance
reviews.reviewText: This was a well done short story about a female that was held as a slave and was about to be gifted to an alien. The highest ranking alien decided he wanted her and claimed her as his own.The alien who claimed Milly (sorry, can’t go back and get the weird name) was bored with the lifestyles of the rich and nobles and the month long parties they attended. Milly was funny and sweet and he enjoyed her company and made her his companion even though it was bad for his reputation. He treats Milly like an equal and Milly loves him for it, and of course there is a true happily ever after at the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Awwwe! What a sweet loving short story. It was lovely and I wanted to know more about him after reading the Corsair brothers series. Straik for one. And I wasn't disappointed.
Whilst the story is short, it's a decent read. Good if you have about an hour of free time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was a wonderful prequel that I read out of order. It's wonderful to see this side of the man who made a haven for the humans, to please his wife.

A charming romance about a human slave, Milly, in the mesakkah Homeworld. I loved to read it. Varrik a mesakkah lord with a lot of money gives up his place in society in order to be together with his beloved slave Milly. A story full of wonder, tenderness and love. I highly recommend it.
Though short it was perfect. Both H and h were will developed. Would like to read more of these. 👍👍
Out of all the “Pretty” series, I have to say I really adore this one! It really was perfect... but I have come to accept that Ruby really is always perfect! Thanks for this cute little read!!!
